QuestionStem: In which location would energy be transferred more quickly between the atmosphere and Earth's surface?

options.AnswerText: A. a lake, above which the air is 5 °C
options.Feedback: Think about the rate at which thermal energy moves as it relates to the relative temperatures of the substances the energy moves between.

options.AnswerText: B. an ice sheet, above which the air is 5 °C

FinalIncorrectFeedback: Energy would be transferred more quickly between the ice and air because the temperature difference between the two substances is greater.
